text: Carl Ferdinand Cori (5 December, 1896 â€” 20 October, 1984) was an Czech doctor. He won the 1947 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, along with his wife Gerty Cori and Bernardo Houssay, for discovering the way the body processed glycogen and sugar. ==References== Category:Czechoslovak scientists Category:1896 births Category:1984 deaths
title: Carl Ferdinand Cori
